description:
Aman has an array of 'n' non negative integers. According to Aman an array is considered good if the array from some i (i<n) to n-1 can fulfil the following condition:

ar[0]&ar[1]&ar[2]&ar[3]....&ar[i] = ar[i+1]&ar[i+2]....&ar[n-1]

where & is the bitwise AND operation.

You have to determine the number of ways Aman can rearrange the positions of the array such that the array is good for all i from 0 to n - 1. Answer may be large so return it with modulo 10^9 + 7.

Note: We are considering the position and not the elements themselves, see the sample input.

```
Sample Input - 1:

3
1 1 1

Sample Output - 1:

6
```

Explanation: Since all the elements are equal no matter how we rearrange the the position, the array will always be good. There are three positions and they can be permutated in 6 ways.

```
Sample Input - 2:

5
1 2 3 4 5

Sample Output - 2:

0
```

Explanation: There are no permutations possible for the position of elements for which the array sequence comes out to be good for all i from 0 to n-1.

```
Constraints:

1<=n<=10^5
1<=ar[i]<=10^8
```
title: AND of Aman's sequence
